page.title: 04Gorran Haven - Fishing
page.content: In the 19th Century Gorran Haven was a busy and prosperous fishing community with about 30 boats,60 fishermen and a flourishing boatbuilding industry. Today there are only part-time fishermen;6 to 10 boats go line fishing for mackerel,pollack,mullet and bass.About 6 boats go out working 20 to 30 crab and lobster pots.All the catch is sold at Mevagissey - 5 miles away.In the summer several boats work taking visitors out on angling trips. The reason for the decline in fishing is the modernisation of the industry - one large boat with modern equipment can catch more fish in one day than the old boats caught in a week.Hence, the seas around this coast have been overfished and the small fisherman can no longer make a living.
